Yeah I barely understand my own requirements!
Anyway, I will give it a try, it might help me to
explain it better anyway.

So currently I have a system that searches through a
database using SqlSever FullText Indexing.  This
basically prevents me from having to write the LIKE
statements etc....
Well I was thinking about rathing than using that
coming up with a set of inputs such as Page UpTime,
Num Clicks, etc.. and using those inputs into the
Neural Network and using Ga to evolve the weights. 
Well I have looked at the smartsweepers example on
ai-junkie and Matt has done a gerat job, but I am not
sure how I could apply it to my solution. For instance
inthe smartsweepers problem he had a controller which
iterataed through the sweepers and each sweeper had a
brain independent of the other sweepers. For my
problem would I have a SearchSweeper with its own
brain and then it would get a list of results from the
database(perhaps FullText INdexing still) and then
rank them on the basis of the weights of the inputs or
should each search result have its own brain and
determine its own ranking?
Does that help, not sure if it does.
Thanks,
Rog

--- Colin Green <cgreen@...> wrote:
> Hi Roger,
> 
> Sorry you still lost me! I think you need to back up
> a bit and explain 
> in lay mans terms what you want to achieve. Do you
> want to implement an 
> actual search engine where a search phrase is input
> and a load of 
> results are output? or do you want to somehow extend
> the results from an 
> existing search engine?
> 
> Colin
> 
> Roger Smith wrote:
> 
> >Hey all,
> >I am going to rephrase my question.
> >I guess what I am trying to figure out is if I
> should
> >have a SearchController which has "The Brain" (the
> >neural net) and then when it searches it filters
> the
> >search results through the weights to get the
> ranking
> >OR 
> >does each Search result have a brain?
> >Any thoughts, ideas?
> >Thanks,
> >Rog
> >  
> >
> 
>
